channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Broken pavement, 23rd February
item.description:
The pavement in front of our property at 6 The Hamblins is damaged. There is a substantial hole in the pavement directly outside our pedestrian gate. It is not safe for visitors to enter the property. Furthermore, the collapse of the pavement bordering our driveway has caused the paving within our property to subside, making it difficult to enter and exit our driveway by car. This is an ongoing issue which has worsened in the past year. I'm afraid the photographs may do fully reflect the extent of the damage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The footpath outside 57,55,53 and 51 Leckhampton Road turns into a stream when it rains and this is getting worse with more water erosion., 23rd February
item.description:
This is because Leckhampton Road road surface was built up too high and the curbs dropped in 2008 when it was resurfaced then and caused the problem, and it's got much worse since. The water used to run down the storm drain outside 53 but now half diverts off the driveways of 57 and 55 on to the footpath (see the 2 darker photos). I have had to build a barrier at the edge of my property (53) which would flood to protect my property and the builder who bought 51 (and also built 51A) resurfaced the footpath as a continuation of the private road as the stream on Leckhampton Road footpath would turn 90 degrees left down the private road to the side of 51 and 51A and would flood Whitley Court at the bottom. You can see the large puddles outside 53 and 51 which stay for ages (the latter which blocks the whole footpath each time it rains). Brian Waldron Area Highway Officer came out in 2008 (case number 84880) and said it used to be an old tramway but no work has been done to change this. The road surface needs lowering and/or curbs need raising or extra drains put in to divert water off the road from pouring on to the footpath and into the properties which will happen if it rains more heavily one day.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Litter all along the verges of the A40, 23rd February
item.description:
The entirety of the verges along the A40 between the Elmbridge Court roundabout and Cheltenham are covered in litter. This is not a road that is litter picked by National Highways and falls under the authority of the local council.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More potholes, 23rd February
item.description:
Several pot holes have appeared again. Driving along the road is very dangerous vehicle swerving out the way of the potholes going into on coming traffic. There will be a accident soon if these issues are sorted. Fear for cyclists at night.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Woodlands Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Very bad potholes all the way along the road, 23rd February
item.description:
